results.title: The Banana! very simple yet so delicious...
results.material_description: digital screen recording of Amauryguichon's tiktok post
results.brief_description: The extraordinary popularity of videos on social media that show food being prepared in short snappy close ups gives credence to the screenwriting cliche “show it don’t say it”. There’s a sensory, hypnotic satisfaction in watching someone make a simple sandwich, or in the case of Amaury Guichon, an impossibly complicated confection.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

The extraordinary popularity of videos on social media that show food being prepared in short snappy close ups gives credence to the screenwriting cliché “show it, don’t say it”. There’s a sensory, hypnotic satisfaction in watching someone make a simple sandwich, or in the case of Amaury Guichon, an impossibly complicated confection.
description_for_label: The extraordinary popularity of videos on social media that show food being prepared in short snappy close ups gives credence to the screenwriting cliché “show it, don’t say it”. There’s a sensory, hypnotic satisfaction in watching someone make a simple sandwich, or in the case of Amaury Guichon, an impossibly complicated confection.

details.label: Curatorial section
display_values: The Story of the Moving Image → Moving Minds → MM-09. Catch of the Day

details.label: Materials
display_values: digital screen recording of Amauryguichon's tiktok post

results.title: Vitaphone disc, "Wall Street", reel two
results.brief_description: Vitaphone was a sound film system used for feature films and nearly 1,000 short subjects made by Warner Bros. and its sister studio First National from 1926 to 1931. Vitaphone was the last major analog sound-on-disc system and the only one which was widely used and commercially successful.
results.description: Vitaphone was a sound film system used for feature films and nearly 1,000 short subjects made by Warner Bros. and its sister studio First National from 1926 to 1931. results.title: House in summer magic lantern slide
results.brief_description: Magic lantern slide with wooden frame. The coloured slide shows a English style house and gardens. Several pencil marking on the wood. On the underside, ‘57’ has been written in a thick white ink.
results.description: Magic lantern slide with wooden frame. The coloured slide shows a English style house and gardens. Several pencil marking on the wood. On the underside, ‘57’ has been written in a thick white ink.

results.title: Magic lantern slipping slide (Knight and Princess)
results.brief_description: Magic lantern set effects slide with dark wooden frame. By sliding the effects slide, a a princess pushes a knight from her window or cuts his climbing rope, resulting in his fall Set against a black background.

results.title: Magic lantern three-panel slipping slide (Flower Bloom)
results.brief_description: Magic lantern set effects slide with wooden frame. The coloured slide shows a flower bud blooming. Two adjustable sliding pieces of glass - slide left and right to show the flower blooming. Set against a black background. Made by W.F. Archer, Liverpool, 43 Lord St and 63 South Castle St. ‘49’ and ‘R’ written in pencil on wooden frame.
results.description: Magic lantern set effects slide with wooden frame. The coloured slide shows a flower bud blooming.
